rti_python.Codecs package¶

Submodules¶

rti_python.Codecs.BinaryCodec module¶

class rti_python.Codecs.BinaryCodec.AddDataThread¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Receive all incoming data. Buffer the data and wakeup ProcessDataThread with “condition”.

add(data)¶

Add data to the buffer. Then wakeup the internal thread with the “internal_condition”. :param data: Data to buffer. :return:

run()¶

Take the data from the temp location and place it the buffer. Then wakeup the ProcessDataThread with “condition”. :return:

shutdown()¶

Shutdown the object. Stop the thread. :return:

class rti_python.Codecs.BinaryCodec.BinaryCodec¶

Bases: object

Use the 2 threads, AddDataThread and ProcessDataThread to buffer the streaming data and decode it.

Subscribe to ensemble_event to receive the latest decoded data. bin_codec.ensemble_event += event_handler

event_handler(self, sender, ens)

AddDataThread will buffer the data. ProcessDataThread will decode the buffer.

add(data)¶

Add data to the AddDataThread. This will start the processing of the data. :param data: Data to start decoding. :return:

buffer_size()¶

Monitor the buffer size. :return: Buffer size to monitor.

static decode_data_sets(ens)¶

Decode the datasets in the ensemble.

Use verify_ens_data if you are using this as a static method to verify the data is correct. :param ens: Ensemble data. Decode the dataset. :return: Return the decoded ensemble.

ensemble_event(ens)¶

Event to subscribe to receive the latest ensemble data. :param ens: Ensemble object :return:

receive_ens(sender, ens)¶

Event handler for ProcessDataThread to receive the latest ensembles. :param sender: Not Used :param ens: Ensemble data :return:

shutdown()¶

Shutdown the two threads. :return:

static verify_ens_data(ens_data, ens_start=0)¶

This will check the checksum and verify it is correct. :param ens_data: Ensemble data. :param ens_start: Start location in the ens_data

class rti_python.Codecs.BinaryCodec.ProcessDataThread¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Process the incoming data. This will take the shared buffer. The AddDataThread will wakeup this thread with “condition”. It will then process the incoming data in the buffer and look for ensemble data. When ensemble data is decoded it will passed to the subscribers of the event “ensemble_event”.

ensemble_event(ens)¶

Event to subscribe to receive decoded ensembles. :param ens: Ensemble object. :return:

run()¶

Get the global buffer that is shared with the AddDataThread.

When data is received, the this thread will be unblocked with “condition”. Process the incoming data. Look for ensemble data. Verify and decode the binary data. Once an ensemble is processed, pass it to event. All subscribers of the event will receive the ensemble. :return:

shutdown()¶

Shutdown this object. :return:

verify_and_decode(ens_bin)¶
